history.content:
<md>1. If you have conflicting courses, at least 1 has to allow time conflicts. If so, then you can take both.
2. If there are conflicting final exam times, it is up to one of the courses to give you an alternate exam time. Since 170 is allowing it, I would expect that they will have alternate exam times for conflicts, and you can ask them about it on piazza when it is created.
 </md>

I'd like to take CS 170 and Physics C191 in Fall 2021, but their main lecture times overlap. However, CS 170 is allowing time conflicts, and I have several questions about the relevant policies:

  1. If only one course is allowing time conflicts, would I still be allowed to take both?
  2. If yes to (1), how do I deal with conflicting final exam times? Since CS 170 is the course allowing time conflicts, do I reach out to their course staff/instructors? Or should I also reach out to Physics C191?

Thanks in advance!
history.subject: Logistics of Time Conflicts
